Given the output after time T, \\( z(T) \\), and knowing it follows the differential equation \\( \\frac{dz}{dt} = Pz \\), can we precisely infer the initial condition \\( z_0 \\) if there was an application of \\( T(z) \\)?
Explanation: Since the transformation \\( T(z) \\) depends on an integration across the function's evolution, this aggregation obfuscates the direct traceability back to \\( z_0 \\). Individual characteristics of the original state are obscured by the integral, making it impossible to reconstruct \\( z_0 \\) uniquely without explicit knowledge of having not applied \\( T(z) \\).
